## Introduction

::: {.nonincremental}
- __Social network analysis (SNA)__ is a process used for analysis of social structure by the use of networks and graph-theory. 


- A primary area of study in (SNA) is the analysis of community structure through use of algorithms appropriately referred to as "__community detection algorithms__".

- Rostami et al (2023) note that community detection in social networks is a challenging field of study as there is no clear cut model which describes what exactly a "community" is.
:::
